website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive greenhouse kit is a good way to seed start without spending a lot of extra money.
pros: The kit makes garden starting extremely easy
includes peat pots you can plant your seed directly in
Also comes in a 50-plant starter kit with slightly larger pots to hold the new plants longer
cons: This kit is not as sturdy as some others

customer_reviews.title: Super great for beginner gardeners
customer_reviews.text: I have used these two years in a row now and they are perfect and make gardening super easy for beginner gardeners. A lot of the research I found said that bottom watering is ideal so that the different types of plants can just grab the water they need. It also helps reduce desease. Also the little soil pods are so easy to use and make transplanting so much easier. This year has been way more successful as I did some research and also bought some LED lights to help with my indoor seed starter growth. I got the ACKE LED Grow Light Board and they are working great together...check out my pics!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette B.

customer_reviews.title: A fast easy way to start seeds
customer_reviews.text: A fast easy way to start seeds. Wish the lid fit more securely. I add water to soften and slightly plump the pods, then add a few seeds per pod, then I pinch a little soil to cover seeds and add more water to completely moisten and keep lid on to keep moist till seeds sprout. Warm and light are very important and the tray works very well to use in green house, indoor under plant light or just put outdoors in warm weather. When seeds have germinated you can put pods directly in soil in garden bed or in pot.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Go To Seed Starter
customer_reviews.text: These Jiffy pellets are becoming my go-to seed starters. I've fooled around with alternatives but consistently get the best results with these. One of the big advantages over soil based starters is ease of transplanting. Take out the pellet, gently pull away the fabric cover, and plant. Root damage is less likely than when trying to get a soil capsule out of a plastic holder. As an aside, I recently read a tip about using these for short cold stratification. I put some Royal Catchfly seeds in the pellets, put the pellets in the refrigerator for one week and then removed. I quickly got 90% germination. Neat!
customer_reviews.author: Gunona

customer_reviews.title: Cover is really cheap
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say yet if any plants grow, but already ran into a problem. The clear cover, which is made of very cheap plastic won’t sit evenly on the tray. If I get one side down the other pops up. Occasionally I can get 3 corners in place but the 4th corner pops up. The top is twisted. I have to put some kind of light weight on both ends to keep it down but the weight has to be light because the top will crush in.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Total failure...do not buy
customer_reviews.text: we bought 4 of these seed starter trays...a total of 200 pods that we placed a variety of seeds in...we kept the pods moist but not over watered...of the 200 pods only 1 seed sprouted...yes...just 1 spout...when lifting these trays they would fold in the center which made it difficult to carry...PLEASE do not waste your money of these...we wish we knew what caused this total failure of seed sprouting...it was like a poison of some kind had killed the seeds in the pods...terribly disappointing...and a total waste of money...and seeds
customer_reviews.author: SD Chuckles

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these, based on the positive reviews. I planted 4 different kinds of seeds, to include sweet peppers and 3 types of perennial flower seeds. I have 1 tiny seedling weeks later. I also was given a Burpees brand tray, in which I planted tomato seeds & a perennial flower seed type - all of those came up. I won't be buying another one of the Jiffy products, but I already ordered another Burpees brand tray.
customer_reviews.author: JEN

customer_reviews.title: Cheap propogator but the pods are good
customer_reviews.text: The propogator lid is a little thin for how wide long the tray is. It deformed before I even got to use it. Also wish it was taped on each side because I was missing 3 disks. I tore apart the box it came in and still nowhere to be found They seem to do the job up until you see a sprout. Helps the roots get oxygen as long as u let it dry out a day or 2 after u soak them. I cut the bottom of the netting and down the sides a little with a razor before putting them in soil. Seemed like it would help but that's just me
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: They really work
customer_reviews.text: I bought a packet of Asclepias Butterfly Milkweed seeds from Burpee and decided to try to start an indoor grow in one of these trays. I thought it was a little flimsy at first but it ended up being perfect. If you add too much water, mold will grow. Just remove the cover and if you have a little fan you can use that over it. I started with 40 seeds and almost all of them grew. After the first leaves started I had to transplant to bigger styrofoam cups. These trays really do work.
customer_reviews.author: h8pigs

customer_reviews.title: Built for expert growers that aren't needing to grow thier plants quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Small "green house" I recommend another larger Top as my plants outgrew this one rather quickly. The nutrients are great, my plants sprung up really quick! Definitely worth it for the price. Humidity foam far too low to be effective...I'd give it about a 3 stars but rapid rooters are 3x better. Basically can drown your young plants, where as rapid rooters have a better balance between air material & water for roots. From my research, Rock wool is also going to give you far bigger roots quicker. I believe my plants struggled far more then was nessisary.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Paul Jankowski

customer_reviews.title: Found cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought one I seen at Home Depot for 3 dollars... not kidding. Exact same thing. If I had the orignal packaging and knew how to return it I would. I could literally buy 6 of these for the price. Which is the point in gardening from tiny seeds. Your supposed to save money instead of buying the already 5-6$ slightly grown vegetable in a pot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I started vegetable seeds in this and not only did all the seeds sprout it was neat and clean. I set the whole thing up in my kitchen and there was no mess to clean up. As the seedlings got larger I took them out, replaced the peat pellets and started a new batch. A much more economical way to grow veggies than buying larger plants at the nursery- no weeds or bugs either.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Jiffy 50 pod greenhouse
customer_reviews.text: I’ve started my own garden from seed and these are so convienent comes with 50 pellets ready to put your seeds in and water... I have about 5 of them, also I bought the extended dome for the ones the grow so tall....
customer_reviews.author: Busdriverkel

customer_reviews.title: Best way to start seeds.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition. I've used these for years, and this is the best way to start seeds. Highly recommended. Oh, yes: the tray and dome can be used over again, as the peat pellets are available in most garden stores.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Rye

customer_reviews.title: A fun way to start seeds indoors.
customer_reviews.text: Starting plants from seeds is a fun project - particularly for those of us in the northern climates. It gives me a "head start" on the growing season. This tray is well made and sturdy. It needs to be sturdy as it is a little heavy once you hydrate the peat circles. The tray has two levels, with a bottom area that fills with water, which also makes the tray heavier when filled. I've had success planting ground cherry seeds in these mini-greenhouses and now I'm trying wild strawberries. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works just as I remembered using these as a kid ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just as I remembered using these as a kid. I used 25 the first time around, saved the other 25 for any other seeds in the future. There's something satisfying about seeing all of these uniform "pods" sprout and grow seedlings. Grew borage, average germination in 7-14 days is claimed. On day 3 I noticed the first sprouts. Day 4 that quantity had tripled. It's now been only about a week and I've already transplanted several. The ones left are about 3-4" tall.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for newly/slow growing plants
customer_reviews.text: These would not work for tall leggy seedling but are perfect for the shorter ones. Great to be able to start so many seedling at once. Kind of worked out a way to indicate what seeds are in which pots by putting a plant tag at the beginning and end of the row of that type of seed. I have a number of "rare" seeds that only have 10-20 seeds while others have 100 plus seeds. We'll see how they do!
customer_reviews.author: Jan S

customer_reviews.title: These expand a lot more than I thought. Give ...
customer_reviews.text: These expand a lot more than I thought. Give yourself several hours of slowly adding warm water to get them to expand right. Just set it on top of the fridge after putting seeds in with the cover on (cover didn't fit properly, it sits on top as opposed to locking in place), in about five days I have seedlings. They grew more quickly in this than in the similar greenhouse you add your own potting soil to and were less of a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Boooo

customer_reviews.title: Great for Starting and Great for Transplanting
customer_reviews.text: These work like a charm - letting you establish depth and they retain moisture well. My seeds went from sprouts to pots in twice the speed and with considerably better health/vibrancy than seeds I tried to germinate in something called a Grodan plug. Peat plugs are your best bet and this format is extremely convenient. I just wish they sold it in a smaller format.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only growing tray we use now
customer_reviews.text: Great performance from this tray. We grow seedlings in our basement every spring for our raised beds and we have used this brand the last several years. We have tried others including simple potting soil in containers but nothing has beat the way these sprout seeds and keeps them in moist conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi Kobayashi

customer_reviews.title: I'll never buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I've used these trays for years and have always had wonderful results- this one however- literally only 5 seeds I planted germinated. I planted several different seeds- all good seeds- but none grew. Im not sure why this didn't work for me this year
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Clark

customer_reviews.title: Just as my tomato seedlings broke the surface, a ...
customer_reviews.text: Just as my tomato seedlings broke the surface, a thick, white mould grew on the sides and tops of the cells. This sometimes happens after a few weeks, and is usually controllable with a fungicide. This time, the fuzzy nastiness showed up within a week of hydration, likely caused by contamination somewhere in production or storage. Was unable to control. Believe it to not be just a surface problem, but an infestation through out the medium making up the cells. Now, only five of the forty plants have survived. The tomato portion of my garden is off to a disappointing start.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sure grows a lot of plants fast
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic seed starting containers that can be used year over year (just refill the pellets). Germination is fast, and the baby plants look so cute when they first poke out of their seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient set up
customer_reviews.text: It’s mid February in California with temperature of 69 degrees, so yesterday I made a pot of hot water on the stove to prep my soil pellets. Today I planted my seeds! I plan to keep them indoors with a grow light for about a month until the nighttime temps warm up a bit! Hope this works well, so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: That1Chick

customer_reviews.title: If you are going to use a Heater-
customer_reviews.text: Overall this product will work as is but if you are going to use a Heater you will need and additional tray to set the Heater into and then set the tray that comes with the product onto that. I didn't notice that until it arrived. If you don't need a Heater this will work fine as is. if you want a Heater buy a 2nd tray. The whole purpose of starting flowers from seed in January is to get a head start on planting into the ground after the frost is gone.Looking for a 2nd tray.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Quick
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for starting veggies out in from seed. I was just itching to go plant, but it was still too cold out, and I have issues growing from seed outside. These little guys were perfect they quickly grew my seeds, and they were very low maintence. I only had to water once a week. It work for tomatoes, luffa sponges, huckle berries, water melons, and zucchini.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Frith-Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Mold, mold, mold
customer_reviews.text: EVERY SEED OVERWHELMED BY MOLD. As we prepare for the Covid Pandemic we thought we planned right... but though we followed directions carefully, covered the trays, mold too over and killed everything. Maybe we were delivered old trays that were stored improperly.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product before with good success but this time it was a complete failure. I'm wondering if I got a counterfeit or something. I am not a novice gardener and I followed the directions, used a heat mat, lights...I'm not sure what happened but only 2-3 pods sprouted. Will not buy this product from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: MaryJaneParker

customer_reviews.title: This was great for starting seeds this spring
customer_reviews.text: This was great for starting seeds this spring! Cost effective and now I have seedlings to plant in the garden!
customer_reviews.author: skinnyleg

customer_reviews.title: looked like a nice kit.
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I returned this because I decided to go with my usual practice of buying pre-grown flowers from a garden store. That being said. the kit was a nice size and looked like it would have been good if I had been willing to put in the effort to work with seedlings.
customer_reviews.author: mctamazon

customer_reviews.title: Classic, easy seed starter
customer_reviews.text: This is the classic. Easiest way to start and plant seeds. The "greenhouse" is very flimsy though, so make sure you don't have to move it once it is set up. It can't support the weight of the peat pods once they are wet. One of mine bent in the middle and my peat pods all fell out and ruined the seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up. Seeds sprouted after a few days!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Use a little more water than recommendation to expand pods. I used a toothpick to fluff up soil before adding seeds. I left a couple of empty spots so I could add water to the bottom of the tray. Pods are packed in once expanded.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Drellack

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is very easy to use. I’m starting my first ever mini veggie garden and added the colder weather seeds (greens, radishes, peas) to this mix. I’ll update this post after I compare to planting in peat pots.
customer_reviews.author: RedheadwalkingTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, so far very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: They arrived in perfect condition. Great germination percentage, out of 100 cells ( 2 x 50 plant sets) 93 have seedlings.
customer_reviews.author: Jammy302

customer_reviews.title: Cheap flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could return this once you get the water in the pods it’s too heavy to pick up without buckling and all fall out very frustrating. plastic should be stronger and also the lid doesn’t stay on well at all
customer_reviews.author: Denise Rempel

customer_reviews.title: Efficient little seed starter
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool system for seed starting and doesn't require much space. Many seeds have temperature limits for germination. This system makes off season starts possible and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the pellet wrapping!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you're okay with the wrapping. The 50mm size has biodegradable wrap so you just plant and that's that. The 42mm require peeling off the nylon wrapping. This isn't a big deal, however it could damage the new roots.
customer_reviews.author: BES

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long. Too wet. Attracts mold.
customer_reviews.text: This product didn’t work. I used same seeds with potting mix and they sprouted in few days while these took forever to sprout. I thought it was the quality of the seeds but that’s not true. It also got white mold on them after a month. So I had to throw them away. I will not be using these again. From my personal experience just sow the seeds in soil. I used seed starter and potting mix. Results were mind blowing. In only 3-4 days I started seeing plants.
customer_reviews.author: gari

customer_reviews.title: These work great and can use again
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 of these in the end and I bought 3 bags of the pellets to refill them once the seeds sprout and grow. Can reuse these over and over. Really like them and love that the pellets have a "holder" to stop them from falling over when you pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: catladyof6

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to start your garden early
customer_reviews.text: 4 days and I have 9 cucumber plants already. Waiting on my peppers & tomatoes, but I have no reason to believe they aren't going to sprout soon. Very easy to start germination, cover keeps the humidity up. Seeds and green house is much cheaper than buying individual plants. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: pope66682

customer_reviews.title: Great item to get your seedlings going.
customer_reviews.text: Great item to get your seedlings going. There are holes and vents to the bottom which helps even water distribution. The mulch is a great mix to help the seeds with nutrients to help grow. The lid is great but I tape it down to stop it from blowing away or use small rocks to keep weight. I have used these a few years in a row. Also easy to use for newbies to gardening like me.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is magic.... Less than ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is magic.... Less than 1 week and I had to take the lid off already because of how crazy my seeds were growing.
customer_reviews.author: Gregor Thomas

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews across various sites saying that the greenhouses were arriving busted or otherwise damaged, I was pleased to find mine entirely pristine and intact upon arrival. The product is extremely useful and saves a lot of space and confusion with seed germination. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Pixi

customer_reviews.title: Nah not for me!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, terrible, very sad is all I can say! I did all my research, bought the best seeds and maybe had 5 little plants in a month! I even went to the expense of purchasing a hot house thinking this would be so awesome and would yield amazing results but nope not at all! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: Sprouts seeds really quickly (with low heat source)
customer_reviews.text: With a low heat source added (~70 degrees), this sprouted herbs very quickly in March. The tray is a little flimsy, so I put it on a big baking sheet to move it around more easily. I just followed the instructions on the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorJerboa

customer_reviews.title: Works, all my seeds sprouted
customer_reviews.text: All of my seeds sprouted as intended, this is a very easy way to get seedlings. and the tray is reusable if you buy the soil discs separately. I would be careful with the directed amount of water it says to add though. I did about 5 discs at a time to monitor it more. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Guthier

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've never used these trays before, but I always wanted to. So, I decided to give it a go and the results were amazing. My radish seeds were the first to sprout then it was like a chain reaction and all my other seeds started to sprout. I was kind of skeptical, because I usually start seeds outside in their permanent home, but I wanted to try something new so I'd have time to build a garden box and I think I will be using this again for now on. 10/10 highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed... picture attached is David’s seeds ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed... picture attached is David’s seeds beefsteak (big boy) tomatoes day 5 .. 8 of 10 seeds have germinated and emerged 4 of which are high above the soil with cotyledon ... 80% success in 5 days is very impressive... I’m sure the others won’t be far behind
customer_reviews.author: alexander figueredo

customer_reviews.title: NOT ONE SEED CAME UP!
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst products I have ever bought on Amazon. We followed all the directions and not one(1) seed came up. Thought maybe we got old seeds so went and bought a brand new pack dated for this year and again no luck. I have used products like this before but never with these results. I would never buy this product again
customer_reviews.author: grilldaddy

customer_reviews.title: great way to start seeds
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My seeds started sprouting within 3 days and still sprouting. I'm also using a heating pad and thermostat with it. Only one thing and that is Home Depot IS cheaper by $10.00+ what is up with that?
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: A 100% success rate
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I put five kinds of seeds (Herbs: Oregano, Basil, Thyme, Parsley and Dill) in the 50 pellets and 2-3 weeks later all of them sprouted! A 100% success rate is a first for me. I transplanted them to a bigger area of soil and so far all of them are growing beautifully. I like the kit so much that I purchased 50 more pellets for my other herbs.
customer_reviews.author: mmmwl

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Kit
customer_reviews.text: Great seed staring kit! All you need, minus tags, and the plastic top fits nicely, I let it hang over or prop it up with toothpicks for ventilation. Too much humidity can cause seedling damping off. Tray carries well when pods are wet, I can see myself using this for a few seasons before replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Scoobster

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for mold
customer_reviews.text: I put the lid on and mold started growing INSTANTLY. Why? I followed the instructions perfectly. So the lid goes in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Paquin

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy product.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set. Provided the ability to start a whole lot more plants than I envisioned. Pretty sturdy given how light it is, as evidenced by it withstanding things being dropped on it, it getting kicked from it's place on the floor, and general negligent abuse. It will be ready for me to start more plants later on in the season.
customer_reviews.author: Spell

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly.  Arrived well packaged.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect base for beginning from seed. Lid is too shallow to be worth much of anything after a couple of weeks. What a pain.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaAmanda

customer_reviews.title: I'm really pleased with them so far
customer_reviews.text: My first time using these, long-time grower. I'm really pleased with them so far. Easy to use - just add water to hydrate, then pop your seeds in them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bliss

customer_reviews.title: dont know if its the dirt or the seeds or both :(
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my daughter's class to start growing flowers and none of them sprouted. I don't know if it was the seeds or if it was the dirt pods I just know I have 18 kids who are upset who don't have flowers.
customer_reviews.author: janel

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but expensive compared to results
customer_reviews.text: A nice idea but a better quality of soil is needed in the pods. Personal I don't thing the pod system is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Little bit of a pain but overall they're nice.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to use these for seed starting this year instead of manually filling cells. These seem to work well. Sometimes you have to rip the netting to uncover the top of the cell though. Little bit of a pain but overall they're nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cadez

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Planted seeds in this starter tray and had results in a week. Will finally have an early start on my garden once the weather cooperates.
customer_reviews.author: John Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, gets great results
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to start my garden from seeds. I usually buy starter plants from a local nursery, but with the COVID-19 pandemic, I wasn't sure whether our nursery would be open by planting time. This is my first time beginning my vegetable garden from seeds, and I'm happy to report that all of my seedlings are doing well, thanks to this affordable and easy to use product. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea L Miller

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money! The top was bent and cracked on arrival. I tried to fix it but it didn't work(of course). The seed pods didn't expand all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Most seeds germinated quickly and were healthy. I moved them to larger pots and they did very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this started molding as soon as water was added to the product and we ended up throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Rian Martin

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Mess-Free, but Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I started my garden in this. Easy to use, not messy at all. My main complaint is that the base is REALLY flimsy. We had a torrential rain the other night, and the entire planter filled with water. When I carefully tried to pick it up to empty it (it was on my deck table, and the deck had been freshly power-washed), it caved in and dirt went everywhere. As long as it isn't over-watered, it serves it's purpose. Still, moving it inside and out can be tricky because the base isn't very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Erin F

customer_reviews.title: Good thing it's just dirt
customer_reviews.text: Box was smashed and all the pods were loose but at least it's just dirt and it works for my seeds
customer_reviews.author: Megs

customer_reviews.title: Easily build your garden from seed!
customer_reviews.text: Easily starting seeds at home. Fun to watch the seeds sprout! Great invention! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DawnsHomeLifestyle

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT, this tray is a nice size and very ...
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT, this tray is a nice size and very easy to use. I am sure my plants will do much better with the head start they are getting inside one month early start. The package is super light and you add water to expand the soil pods. pretty amazing, the soak up 10 cups of water and become ready to plant pods!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: On a hot day do not leave the lid on i think i cooked my seeds but my fault overall this is a great product and i can say with all honesty its a buy over again ...nicely priced !!
customer_reviews.author: MellowIrishGent

customer_reviews.title: Bargin for damaged packing
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and order this product. it description stated damaged packaging. The package was indeed damaged however, the product was fully intact and not missing any parts. Great deal for a slight imperfection.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Northern

customer_reviews.title: Healthy plants
customer_reviews.text: I had issues...rapid water evaporation causing drying pr constant water addition causing mold, heat pad too hot so it needs constant attention
customer_reviews.author: JEAN M. Halsey

customer_reviews.title: seeds germinated
customer_reviews.text: love the ease of use......apparently it has what it needs........seeds germinated quickly!
customer_reviews.author: cab4328

customer_reviews.title: Terrific, easy seed starters
customer_reviews.text: These I bought in addition to extra peat pots. I put them in my greenhouse & they are doing great. I used the tops for my surplus peat pots. Everything is growing great. Things came up in mere days. So easy to use. Nicely delivered & very happy w/ my results. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda M. Breeze

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really easy if you like neat and want to have kids help, just put water and add seeds
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm hooked.
customer_reviews.text: First time using them, don't think I will use anything else after using these. Great success rate with the seeds I planted, easy to water, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It worked really well, my only complaint is that the lid is a little flimsy and can be easily moved off the top. Other than that, This thing was essential for starting my garden this year and it worked to get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on these. I tried them the first year I started seeds indoors but you can start seeds with a little potting soil and any type of container. I used containers flowers can in last year and old sour cream containers. A lot cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: These were easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to use. Love the fact I will be able to plant straight into ground. I already have seeds growing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Next best thing to a greenhouse
customer_reviews.text: The clear plastic covers provide an excellent environment for germinated seedlings. I've used the peat pods for decades. An excellent starter medium.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua SSP

customer_reviews.title: simple good product
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as advertised. Floating tray allows exess water to collect so no mess. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Islanderfarmgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what it appears. Everything was in tact and ready to use. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: HouseGriffith

customer_reviews.title: I thought these were great! I bought some seeds from Costco not knowing ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were great! I bought some seeds from Costco not knowing that they had to be "sown", so I bought this to go along with them. Almost all of the plants grew really well and I was able to move them over into my garden - we'll see if they continue to grow there!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cason Adams

customer_reviews.title: Half the price at walmart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had one years ago and they work great. I went to Wal-Mart and found the same item for half the price, not on clearance
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Great germ pads
customer_reviews.text: Nice amount of pads. Perfect for germinating. Have used for numerous different seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Fl

customer_reviews.title: good would buy again
customer_reviews.text: its a little flimsy. just be nice to it and you'll be fine. i can see using this for a long time and just buying the refill discs.
customer_reviews.author: Budget Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: General use, Tree Seedlings or Amateur Use Caution.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product, No success for Tree Planting or Philodendron seedlings though, Not A Pro, so limited review validity.
customer_reviews.author: Resort Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff, I used it this spring and will continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Curious-MIke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter tray
customer_reviews.text: I tried for years to start plants with no success. Eventually gave up, figuring I had a black thumb. This year I decided I really wanted to try again, and got this tray to start some veggies in. Within 2 days, half my seeds were germinated. Within 3, there was noticeable seed growth. Still a little bit to go before I can put these little ones outside, but this tray does its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Good concept. Working so far
customer_reviews.text: Good concept. Working so far. These will moldnif not properly vented. If mold appears scrape off any visible mold with a knife without damaging plants. So far so good. Lid is flimsy and doesn't snap on. But not necessary. Be careful when moving.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Bell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I grew a lot of seedlings, and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Gates

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging!
customer_reviews.text: I received this product on time but the greenhouse lid was bent so I couldn't close it properly. I ended up having to tape the lid closed so my seeds would grow into plants. I just planted so I hope my tape job works!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa McWilliams

customer_reviews.title: You can do it
customer_reviews.text: I have used them before. I guess I did not read carefully enough. I thought I would get 5 pellets and got 50. It's OK. These things really work well and I will use them. They are simple and easy to use as long as you have room and a good sunny space. You really can not go wrong..and in the past, I was NOT successful with seeds. This works.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: this is perfect for peppers
customer_reviews.text: I always buy these to start my peppers, this time i had almost all of them sprout and i have no idea where im going to put them all!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sargent Dude

customer_reviews.title: Every seed sprouted!
customer_reviews.text: EVERY seed I planted sprouted! Easy to use, especially with a grow light!
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamperT

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want to grow mold
customer_reviews.text: Great if you want to grow mold. It's better to use the peat pot version with potting soil. Save your money. It will mold very fast, and that's without using the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Wasabi of Boston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Out of the 50 pellets I planted with different seeds, 47 are successfully growing. Previously I had tried just germinating seeds in water or in naturally decomposing containers and they never reached the stage they are at today. Their current stage is so exciting ti watch.. waiting for the last frost to plant them outside.
customer_reviews.author: R V

customer_reviews.title: Packaging.
customer_reviews.text: This box was smaller than the other one and had some brown paper on top. Tossed and tumbled. Not sure yet if the dome lid will still work or not.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Zeman

customer_reviews.title: Paid Too much
customer_reviews.text: I felt silly buying this, because I seen it at Walmart for 7 bucks a week later. But product does the job as far as what it is. There are just better options for much less.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: I start my garden every year with seeds. They produce the strongest planted and highest yields. Grow lights and water is all you have to add and it’s fun watching your garden grow!
customer_reviews.author: ItalianYogi

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these for my starters
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these for my starters! I really wish I could buy more at a time. I live pretty far from any stores that carry them but at least I could get 3 sets started!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these packages. I was super excited to try this method of seed starting. After precisely following the directions on the package, only 5 seeds germinated and sprouted. The rest of the pods turned moldy and did not sprout. I'm very confused by this. I thought this tiny "greenhouse" would work wonders. 95 seeds and seed pods were wasted. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Loving Momm

product_meta.title: Jiffy J450 42mm Professional Greenhouse 50-Plant Starter Kit

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars907 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
